name: Contextual-rnn-gan
tagline: Repository for the paper : Contextual-RNN-GAN for Diagrammatic Abstract Reasoning
body: # GENERATIVE RNN-GAN Project page for the paper [link](https://arxiv.org/abs/1609.09444) Generator ----- * In the forward pass there is no change the Generator is just a simple RNN * In the backward pass instead of the standard backpropagation through time , the error is backpropagated using the gradient of the Discriminator predicting the counterfeit correctly/incorrectly Discriminator ---- At every step of the RNN-GAN , the generations from the Generator has to be saved and then the Discriminator has to be trained on the actual outputs and the outputs generated by the RNN-GAN RNN-GAN --- The discriminator is a MLP which takes a generated image and judges whether it is from the data or fake ( generated by the generator) * The model generates real looking images from the dataset not necessarily imposed that the timestep should be accurate Contextual RNN-GAN ---- Contextual RNN-GAN incorporates context for the timestep as all the preceding images prior to the current timestep. The discriminator is modeled as an RNN which gets all the preceding images to decide whether correct image for the timestep. * The model generates real looking images to generate images accurate according to the particular timestep Some Generations (Contextual-RNN-GAN) ---- Impact of Adversarial Loss ----- Modeling of Consecutive Timesteps ----- Interesting Cases ------ * **First Generation** In the first example generation it is interesting to note that the model correctly predicted elements in off diagonal while faltered in the shape of the elements in leading diagonals. * **Second Generation** Second example shows an interesting case whereby the image gen- erated by our model is also plausible (if by symmetry it is considered that first and third the semicircular ring is solid and hence fourth and sixth should be solid) while the actual answer is of course plausible according to the reasoning that the (solid vs hollow) flipped in the first two cases then stayed the same for the next two timesteps. Even more interesting is its analysis of the spatial dynamics of the ball and the semicircular ring which it almost correctly captured. * **Third Generation** Another very interesting case is the generation which it gets correct. However, in this case the answer figure is exactly similar to the second figure in the se- quence. Therefore, it is not illustrative of the ability of the model to generate the sequence of the pattern. Application of the model to Moving-MNIST ----- Some Example Problems From DAT-DAR Dataset ------
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
